Sentence: Hickey is certain that Larry is the only one who can help Parritt
Larry tauntingly asks whether Hickey's wife finally end up with the iceman
Larry defiantly insists that Hickey has nothing on him (Hickey)
Bitterly Larry condemns Hickey: he (Hickey) has brought them the peace of death
As he (Hickey) speaks, Hickey appears at the doorway and denounces Larry angrily
With Hickey gone, Parritt begins begging Larry anew for help
